definition: to violate/to offend/to assault/criminal/crime/to make a mistake/recurrence (of mistake or sth bad)

sentences.english: The Nazi war criminals were condemned for crimes against humanity.
sentences.chinese: 納粹戰犯因其滅絕人性的罪行而被判刑。

sentences.english: Previous demonstrations have seen reenactments of alleged Nazi war crimes.
sentences.chinese: 而之前的那些遊行裏也能看到對所謂納粹戰犯的扮演。

sentences.english: Executing these war criminals 10,000 times would not atone for their sins.
sentences.chinese: 即使這些甲級戰犯死一萬遍也不能洗刷他們的罪惡。

sentences.english: The Japanese leaders insisted on visiting the Yasukuni Shrine that worships Class-A war criminals during World War II.
sentences.chinese: 日本領導人堅持參拜供奉甲級戰犯的靖國神社。

sentences.english: The old war criminal is at last smoked out from his hiding place abroad.
sentences.chinese: 戰犯終於被人從他在國外的藏匿處查獲。

sentences.english: Three inmates who attacked a Bosnian Serb war criminal in a British jail have been given additional prison sentences.
sentences.chinese: 在英國監獄中襲擊波斯灣戰犯的三名囚犯被加刑。

sentences.english: Many war criminals are still living in South Africa under false names.
sentences.chinese: 許多戰犯仍用假名字住在南非。

sentences.english: Some argue that trying to arrest such war criminals gets in the way of peace talks.
sentences.chinese: 有人堅持認爲，試圖逮捕這些戰犯阻礙了和平談判。

sentences.english: Their search is the last gasp of the post-war hunt for Nazi war criminals.
sentences.chinese: 警方的搜捕表明戰後抓捕納粹戰犯的硝煙未散。

definition: the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
Yasukuni Shrine, Shinto shrine in Tokyo to Japanese war dead, controversial as burial ground of several Class A war criminals
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
Chen Jiongming (1878-1933), a leading warlord of Guangdong faction, defeated in 1925 and fled to Hong Kong
(Claire) Chennault, commander of Flying Tigers during World War II
Japanese Kwantung army (or Kantō army), notorious for numerous atrocities in China during WWII
Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
